intro: Mosiera bahamensis, commonly known as the Bahamian mosiera, is a flowering plant native to the Bahamas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. Mosiera bahamensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for pollinators.
